accounts.gmailAppPasswordHint: ⚠️ Gmail requires App Passwords for ALL accounts. You must enable 2-Step Verification first, then generate an App Password. Regular passwords don't work.
accounts.gmailAppPasswordTitle: How to Set Up Gmail (Required Steps)
accounts.gmailAppPasswordExplanation: As of May 2022, Google requires ALL Gmail accounts to use App Passwords for email clients. This means you must enable 2-Step Verification first (even if you don't want to use it), then generate an App Password. Regular Gmail passwords no longer work with third-party email apps.
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep2: Go to Google Account security settings
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep2Detail: Visit https://myaccount.google.com/security and find the '2-Step Verification' section. Click to enable it if not already enabled.
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep3Detail: After enabling 2-Step Verification, go to https://myaccount.google.com/apppasswords and select 'Mail' and 'Other (Custom name)'.
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep4: Enter 'ayeMail' as the app name and click Generate
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep4Detail: Type 'ayeMail' in the custom name field, then click the Generate button.
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep5: Copy the 16-character password and paste it here
accounts.gmailAppPasswordStep5Detail: Google will show you a 16-character password. Copy it (ignore spaces) and paste it into the password field above. Then click Test Connection.
accounts.gmailAppPasswordNoteDetail: Google discontinued 'Less Secure Apps' access in May 2022. ALL Gmail accounts now require App Passwords for email clients, which means 2-Step Verification must be enabled first.
